author: W3C Publishing Community Group Accessibility Task Force
description: Original wording discussed by a large group representing different actors of the English-speaking geographies. It has been improved after proof of concept implementations and panel testers
All content is available in generated re: All content is available in generated read aloud speech and electronic braille
Portions of the content may not be avail: Portions of the content may not be available in generated read aloud speech and electronic braille
Not all of the content will be available: Not all of the content will be available in generated read aloud speech and electronic braille
Readable in read aloud and braille: Readable in read aloud and braille

All the content is available as pre-reco: All the content is available as pre-recorded audio synchronized with text

Text and page layout can not be modified: Text and page layout can not be modified. The reading experience is close to a print version. Reading systems can still provide zooming options
Ability to modify the appearance is not: Ability to modify the appearance is not known
Contains a table of contents that provid: Contains a table of contents that provides direct access to all chapters of the text via links
Index provides links to item references: Index provides links to item references
Landmarks provide quick access to main p: Landmarks provide quick access to main parts of the book
A page list enables users to coordinate: A page list enables users to coordinate their reading with a statically paginated version
Navigation by table of contents, index,: Navigation by table of contents, index, landmarks, and page list
Contains accessible formulas. Charts and: Contains accessible formulas. Charts and diagrams are present and described by extended descriptions
Contains formulas, charts, and diagrams: Contains formulas, charts, and diagrams without any information about the accessibility of this content
Accessible formulas. Charts and diagrams: Accessible formulas. Charts and diagrams have extended descriptions
Accessibility of formulas, charts, and d: Accessibility of formulas, charts, and diagrams unknown
The publication contains rapidly changin: The publication contains rapidly changing lights or visual stimuli, as well as simulated movements, which can cause discomfort, distraction, photosensitive seizures, or motion sickness

This publication claims to meet minimum: This publication claims to meet minimum accessibility standards
Conformance to accepted standards for ac: Conformance to accepted standards for accessibility of this publication cannot be determined

This publication claims to meet accepted: This publication claims to meet accepted accessibility standards and reports (EPUB Accessibility 1.1 and Web Accessibility Content Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1 Level AA.)

Content is enhanced with ARIA roles to o: Content is enhanced with ARIA roles to optimize organization and facilitate navigation
Videos included in publications have clo: Videos included in publications have closed captions and sign language representation
Tactile graphics have been integrated to: Tactile graphics have been integrated to facilitate access to visual elements by blind people
Music scores are provided that are visua: Music scores are provided that are visually accessible
